about_the_game:
Explore a lush post-apocalyptic world and help a broken robot recover all its pieces. Enjoy 9 worlds filled with secrets and a huge open world to explore.

Shoot enemies with your laser while collecting coins and mysterious ancient treasures like floppy disks and cassette tapes

Wink takes inspiration from Gameboy classics like Super Mario Land 2 and Link’s Awakening, but it's taking that inspiration and running with it. It has been described as a “cross between Megaman and Kirby”. Regardless of the comparisons, Wink has its own personality and a crazy little world to explore all its own

Your purchase includes an executable version of Wink & the Broken Robot which features:

  • 26 levels in 9 worlds from underground caves to factories to waterfalls in the mountains

  • Hop n Bop/Shoot-Em-Up hybrid gameplay. Jump on most enemies or shoot to defeat them

  • 100% accurate Gameboy Color restrictions in sound and gameplay

  • Original chiptune soundtrack by Max Oakland

  • 9 bosses to fight

  • Open world to explore. You can play worlds in whatever order you want and there are many secrets and easter eggs on the overworld map

Explore a lush post-apocalyptic world and help a broken robot recover all its pieces. Enjoy 9 worlds filled with secrets and a huge open world to explore.

Shoot enemies with your laser while collecting coins and mysterious ancient treasures like floppy disks and cassette tapes

Wink takes inspiration from Gameboy classics like Super Mario Land 2 and Link’s Awakening, but it's taking that inspiration and running with it. It has been described as a “cross between Megaman and Kirby”. Regardless of the comparisons, Wink has its own personality and a crazy little world to explore all its own

Your purchase includes an executable version of Wink & the Broken Robot which features:

  • 26 levels in 9 worlds from underground caves to factories to waterfalls in the mountains

name: Wink & the Broken Robot
reviews:
“Playing this game made me feel like a kid again watching saturday morning cartoons when that was a thing. Some big things that I think that are hard to accomplish here were, that the world feels real and inviting and the game feels fun to play. Nothing is too serious where it feels hardcore but there are spots where it gets intense and you take the game seriously, like jumping off the bouncing bubbles in the waterfall.”
Marillmau5

“This is brilliant. Someone else said this, but it bears repeating: the world made me feel like a kid again. It was strange, surreal, yet had it's own sense of internal logic. And like any good title, I couldn't put it down. I thought it would be a short demo and when I got to the overworld my jaw dropped. This is remarkable!”
SuperWhimsy

“This game legit is slick as all hell, I love it so much”
Judy
short_description: You: An eyeball creature exploring a lush post-apocalyptic world. Shoot lasers at enemies to help a broken robot recover all its pieces. Levels are filled with secrets and there’s a huge open world map to explore!
